channel.title: Play 4 free but pay 2 win in tf2?
channel.description:
I've been playing tf2 for a while now (Who am I kidding? Since it came out.) and have been noticing a scary trend in the induction of new weapoms in the game. Now don't get me wrong, I'm not against having new weapons added to the game, or even having to pay for said weapon(s). My problem is this:
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jPZCKW8XHtc[/url]
Not only is this weapon almost hilariously overpowered, it requires absolutely no skill to use, has infinite ammo, and is expensive as ****. If thats not some sort of God weapon I don't know what is, as the only "drawback" it has is that it does reduced damage to buildings, which is moot considering that one charged shot can disable any structure for four seconds. I saw a thread yesterday where some guy was complaining about the injustices of tf2 and how hes perpetually being raped by sentry guns built by the God like engies, and now I can kind of understand where hes coming from.
The solution to the guys problem yesterday, would have been to go spy, sap the sentry and then backstab the engie while hes repairing it. But how would you counteract what is basically a big rape machine disguised as a rocket launcher? I mean seriously I thought this thing was a joke, it lights people on fire too, how is that even remotely fair? The asshole in the video basically rides a one man train on the entire opposing team with [b][i]one[/i][/b] weapon.
I hope this does not set the precedent for other weapons that valve is making for tf2, as this looks likes the biggest **** you from valve ever. So do you think tf2 really will be play for free but pay to win in the near future, or am I just over thinking things (again)?

Fuck you Valve.

SURPLUS_NiNjA:

…TF2 has always had a retro-futurist spytech type feel. It has teleporters, healing beams, invisible cloaks and such. Tell me why lasers don’t fit in with all that?

I agree that lasers can fit in TF2, but they aren’t essential and their current application sucks. Its true that lasers are acceptable in TF2, but why did they have to go to the greedy soldier in the form of a rocket launcher? It makes much more sense for lasers to be implemented by the neglected engineer.

I think the reason I was so against the idea of ray guns/lasers in TF2 is the fact that the ray/laser is in the form of a fucking launcher wielded by the soldier. IMO that idea is absurdly stupid.

everything that was fixed is a simple ommision in displayed stats. The gun itself is the same:

Sorry, I thought it was a nerf and not simply a display update. Not displaying the drawbacks as part of the attributes is a bad idea, they should have just shown them from the start. Instead it was assumed by many, including yourself, that each rocket was as damaging as the normal launcher. From your wiki quote:

OldDirtyBastard:

…This weapon is able to fire 5 blasts of energy that delivers identical damage to players as the Rocket Launcher…

Im sorry but if that were the case then my point is valid. When combined with its flame induction and mini-crit charge ability, the cow mangler could have been considered overpowered in comparison. As it stands now, 5 mangler rounds can deal 405 damage versus the regular launcher’s 4 at 360, not to mention the damage induced from the flames at 3 per tick. If each rocket was actually as strong as we initially thought, you would be comparing the mangler’s 450 + afterburn versus the launcher’s 360. I would consider that overpowered. The fact that it is 10% weaker than the normal launcher does help, but I still think 5 rounds is one too many. At least a recent update slowed the reload rate by 5% (plus fixed an error where charged shots were causing too much damage), so that helps some.

Ive played against the mangler for a little while and I like I’ve said, I didnt have a huge problem with it since I play pyro. I was judging a lot from the initial, misleading stats and from seeing it in action against my teammates.

go tell me ray guns ain’t retro. Or that medic isn’t retro futuristic…

With regards to the medic, hes always had and should have the ability to heal. IMO the healing beam and ubers are a good solution and necessary to keep the medic as a relevant/essential element of tf2. Like I’ve said before, the soldier already has plenty of weapons…and now hes even getting crazy ray guns? That’s just going overboard, it’s unnecessary.
